## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been hearing about the Verus DeFi Testnet, but I'm not entirely sure what it is or why it's important. Can you explain?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that is testing new capabilities and blockchain firsts, which will eventually be implemented on the mainnet. This testnet is a significant milestone for the Verus project, as it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. It's a crucial step in the development of Verus, allowing us to test and refine new protocols before they're deployed on the mainnet.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. What are some of the key features of the Verus DeFi Testnet?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi Testnet has 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, is globally available, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. Additionally, it integrates DeFi and cross-currency liquidity with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, and features a 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm. It's a comprehensive testing environment that allows us to push the boundaries of what's possible with blockchain technology.

**User:**
What's the purpose of the Verus DeFi Testnet, and how can I get involved?

**AI Assistant:**
The purpose of the Verus DeFi Testnet is to test and harden new protocols for eventual implementation on the mainnet. If you're interested in trying out the new protocols, you can join the Verus Discord and ask for a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies in the #pbaas-development channel. Note that all currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have no value and may be reset at any time for testing purposes. By participating in the testnet, you'll be able to get hands-on experience with the latest Verus protocols and provide valuable feedback to the development team.
What is the Verus DeFi Testnet, and what is its significance in the Verus project?

The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that is testing new capabilities and blockchain firsts, which will eventually be implemented on the mainnet. This testnet is a significant milestone for the Verus project, as it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry.

## The New Verus DeFi Testnet
This is the most groundbreaking testnet the Verus project has ever announced, and we believe it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. There are truly so many new capabilities and blockchain firsts working now on testnet that it’s hard to adequately cover them all. Below is a list of new capabilities active on the v0.7.2 testnet that will be on mainnet in the near future when considered fully hardened, tested, and ready for worldwide, public scale. Until then, Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake, worldwide availability, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. If you would like a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies that you can use to try out all of the new protocols from anywhere in the world, simply visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf- **DeFi and cross-currency liquidity integrated with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm** - This is a massive set of platform capabilities that take DeFi further than any project in crypto today. We will list it here and describe it below. Using it is simple. Understanding the implications of what such a protocol can do when rent free and integrated in a truly decentralized public blockchain is a process of realizations that is likely to be similar to layers of an onion. We will do our best to explain below.
